title-part.text: INDEXING SCHEME RELATING TO STRUCTURAL AND PHYSICAL ASPECTS OF SOLID INORGANIC COMPOUNDS

note.note-paragraph: This subclass constitutes an internal scheme for indexing only.
The indexing scheme is used to identify structural and physical aspects of solid inorganic compounds, already classified in class C01 or subclass C09C.

title-part.text: Compounds with a limited amount of crystallinty, e.g. as indicated by a crystallinity index
Intercalated structures, i.e. with atoms or molecules intercalated in their structure
layered hydroxide-type, e.g. of the hydrotalcite-type
Compounds characterised by their crystallite size
defined by measured X-ray, neutron or electron diffraction data
by d-values or two theta-values, e.g. as X-ray diagram
by peak-intensities or a ratio thereof only
by a space-group or by other symmetry indications
by unit-cell parameters, atom positions or structure diagrams
by stacking-plane distances or stacking sequences
defined by measured data other than those specified in group C01P2002/70
by XPS, EDX or EDAX data
by chromatography data, e.g. HPLC, gas chromatography
by thermal analysis data, e.g. TGA, DTA, DSC
Other crystal-structural characteristics not specified above
obtained by TEM, STEM, STM or AFM
extending in one dimension, e.g. needle-like
Nanoscrolls, i.e. tubes having a spiral section
Nanowires or nanorods, i.e. solid nanofibres with two nearly equal dimensions between 1-100 nanometer
Nanostrips, nanoribbons or nanobelts, i.e. solid nanofibres with two significantly differing dimensions between 1-100 nanometer
extending in two dimensions, e.g. plate-like
Nanoplates, i.e. plate-like particles with a thickness from 1-100 nanometer
Aggregated particles or particles with an intergrown morphology
Particles with a specific particle size distribution
Particles characterised by their aspect ratio, i.e. the ratio of sizes in the longest to the shortest dimension
Particles consisting of a mixture of two or more inorganic phases
two phases having the same anion, e.g. both oxidic phases
one phase coated with the other
Thin layer coatings, i.e. the coating thickness being less than 0.1 time the particle radius

note.note-paragraph: Compounds having molecular sieve properties are classified in C01B37/00, C01B39/00.
The following codes are only to be used for physical values deviating significantly from the average usual values.

title-part.text: thermal stability thereof at high temperatures
Attrition-index or crushing strength of granulates
Rheological behaviour as dispersion, e.g. viscosity, sedimentation stability
Alpha, beta or gamma radiation related properties
Optical properties, e.g. expressed in CIELAB-values
Isotope composition differing from the natural occurrence
